results.title: Green Fingers: Weed Control
results.brief_description: ‘Green Fingers’ was a series of short instructional films on home gardening tips, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture. In this episode, ‘Weed Control’, gardener Rod Cantrill demonstrates how to control weeds in the home garden. Cantrill shows a range of methods for managing weeds, including hoeing, mulching and herbicides, accompanied by a narrator who explains the benefits and correct techniques of each method. The episodes of ‘Green Fingers’ are an early example of popular gardening shows in the tradition of ‘Sow What’, ‘Better Homes and Gardens’, and ‘Gardening Australia’.

results.title: Snow safe
results.creator_credit: Jack Creswick and Australian Ski Patrol Association
results.brief_description: A well produced video looking at all aspects of ski and snow safety. Covers appropriate clothing and equipment, selection of equipment, getting proper ski instruction, ski slope courtesy and behaviour, using lifts, ski slope signs, what to do in case of accident or getting lost, care of children, food and hypothermia, and safe tobogganing. Narrated by Debbie Byrne.

results.title: Qantas: I Still Call Australia Home [advertisement]
results.brief_description:
Over twenty years, Qantas has produced a series of commercials featuring the Peter Allen song ‘I Still Call Australia Home’. This is the original mid 1980s version.
Produced by Mojo MDA.

results.title: Early Melbourne: from village to town
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner, Seven Network Limited (Australia) and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Dr Bernard Barrett, State Historian, discusses the early development of Melbourne, covering such topics as the naming of Melbourne, who decided where the streets would be located and what they would be called.

results.title: Ode to a shoebox
results.creator_credit: Narada Lawson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: The outside walls of the housing commission flats were as grey as a winter’s day and as cold as charity. But inside was a warm world of fun, love an adventure. This is an account of living in public housing in Melbourne.
